TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: aitsu a venan kemasi Lunguan i łavek a mangtjez, aya a tjautsikel.
aico a venan kemasi Longoan i ljavek a mangtjez, aya a tjaocikel.
S.TRANSL: Deer came from Lunguan by the sea, according to the story.

S.FORM: saka ka patagił a kemasi i łavek, inika tja sunasian.
saka ka patagilj a kemasi i ljavek, inika tja sonasian.
S.TRANSL: When they began to come from the sea, we didn’t kill them.

S.FORM: azua mamaw tua udjudju anan; saka inika tjen a djemameq nu kemuang itjen.
azoa mamaw toa odjodjo anan; saka inika tjen a djemameq no kemoang itjen.
S.TRANSL: They were still like soft sprouts(?); and we didn’t catch them when we were shooting.

S.FORM: azua ini anan a san satsemeli.
azoa ini anan a san sacemeli.
S.TRANSL: We didn’t then consider them as wild game.

S.FORM: nu tsuatsuay anga saka namasan venan anga, sa puquvał anga, sa putsuqarułqułan anga, tsałeqił anga a kula, vaik anga sema gadu a djemavats.
no coacoay anga saka namasan venan anga, sa poqovalj anga, sa pocoqaroljqoljan anga, caljeqilj anga a kola, vaik anga sema gado a djemavac.
S.TRANSL: After a long time when they had become deer, with hair and hooves and hard feet, they walked up to the mountains.

S.FORM: avan anga zazua tja qałupen anga, sa tja kuangi anga.
avan anga zazoa tja qaljopen anga, sa tja koangi anga.
S.TRANSL: After that we hunted them and shot them.

S.FORM: avan anga zazua patagił a malap itjen tua venan.
avan anga zazoa patagilj a malap itjen toa venan.
S.TRANSL: It was then we began to take deer;

S.FORM: saka malap anga tua zua venan a vetsivetsikan.
saka malap anga toa zoa venan a vecivecikan.
S.TRANSL: and we took the spotted deer.

S.FORM: saka nu uqałay malualu a tequng; saka nu vavayan inika putequng.
saka no oqaljay maloalo a teqong; saka no vavayan inika poteqong.
S.TRANSL: The males had 8-point antlers, and the females had no antlers.

S.FORM: sa liaw anga, sa vaik anga djaravats a penulingelingetj tua kadjunangan.
sa liaw anga, sa vaik anga djaravac a penolingelingetj toa kadjonangan.
S.TRANSL: Their number increased, and they roamed all over the land.

S.FORM: manu metsevung tua zua takets.
mano mecevong toa zoa takec.
S.TRANSL: A deer met a muntjac.

S.FORM: "kasinu sun a djaravaravats?" aya azua takets.
"kasino son a djaravaravac?" aya azoa takec.
S.TRANSL: “Where have you come from roaming about?” said the muntjac.

S.FORM: "imaza ken angata a djaravaravats."
"imaza ken angata a djaravaravac."
S.TRANSL: “I roam all round here.”

S.FORM: "aku izua zazua namaitazua? aku putequng tua liaw? aku vetsivetsikan?" aya zazua takets.
"ako izoa zazoa namaitazoa? ako poteqong toa liaw? ako vecivecikan?" aya zazoa takec.
S.TRANSL: “Why is he like that, with lots of horns and spots?” said the muntjac.

S.FORM: vaik a sema tju Kavulungan.
vaik a sema tjo Kavolongan.
S.TRANSL: And it went to Kavulungan mountain.

S.FORM: saka izua zazua venan a nakemizing izua i tju Kavulungan.
saka izoa zazoa venan a nakemizing izoa i tjo Kavolongan.
S.TRANSL: On Kavulungan there was the ancestor (? OA) of the deer.

S.FORM: saka "izua zazua ku sinitsevungan, sałinga tua tjalupung nua venan azua mareunem.
saka "izoa zazoa ko sinicevongan, saljinga toa tjalopong noa venan azoa mareonem.
S.TRANSL: “I’ve met someone who wants a 6-pointer deer’s hat.

S.FORM: vaik aken a tjeqała," aya azua takets.
vaik aken a tjeqalja," aya azoa takec.
S.TRANSL: I’m off on a journey,” said the muntjac.

S.FORM: sa tjalupungan a tjalupung nua mareunem, sa vaik azua a tjeqała a sema zua tua venan malualu.
sa tjalopongan a tjalopong noa mareonem, sa vaik azoa a tjeqalja a sema zoa toa venan maloalo.
S.TRANSL: He put on the 6-pointer’s hat, and went on a journey to the 8-pointer deer.

S.FORM: manu małavar azua: "aku liaw a su tequng? keḍi a niaken," aya zazua.
mano maljavar azoa: "ako liaw a so teqong? kedri a niaken," aya zazoa.
S.TRANSL: Then he thought: “Why have you got lots of points on your antlers? There are few on mine,” he said.

S.FORM: vaik a tsemikel a sema tju Kavulungan.
vaik a cemikel a sema tjo Kavolongan.
S.TRANSL: He went back to Kavulungan.

S.FORM: "ken a kizułu anan a ku tequng a ku tjalupung," aya zazua takets.
"ken a kizoljo anan a ko teqong a ko tjalopong," aya zazoa takec.
S.TRANSL: “I want to add more points to my hat,” said the muntjac.

S.FORM: manu "neka.
mano "neka.
S.TRANSL: “No.

S.FORM: idan patsikelu," aya zua mareunem.
idan pacikelo," aya zoa mareonem.
S.TRANSL: Give it back,” said the 6-pointer.

S.FORM: saka "upai ku pałiłiay azua su siayaya."
saka "opai ko paljiljiay azoa so siayaya."
S.TRANSL: “Right, I’ll go and see what you are talking about.”

S.FORM: sa vaik anga zazua a tjeqała.
sa vaik anga zazoa a tjeqalja.
S.TRANSL: And he went off on a journey;

S.FORM: łakua inika metsevung.
ljakoa inika mecevong.
S.TRANSL: but didn’t meet anyone.

S.FORM: "aku neka?" aya zazua mareunem ka tsemikel anga.
"ako neka?" aya zazoa mareonem ka cemikel anga.
S.TRANSL: “Why was there noone?” said the 6-pointer when he got back.

S.FORM: "nasa su lutjuken aken.
"nasa so lotjoken aken.
S.TRANSL: “It seems you were just fooling me.

S.FORM: łakua kisedjami a su tjalupung, nasaya su varung.
ljakoa kisedjami a so tjalopong, nasaya so varong.
S.TRANSL: You just thought ‘I’ll borrow your hat’.

S.FORM: iru anga ka ui a pasedjam tjanusun," aya zua mareunem tua takets.
iro anga ka oi a pasedjam tjanoson," aya zoa mareonem toa takec.
S.TRANSL: I certainly won’t lend it to you,” said the 6-pointer to the muntjac.

S.FORM: manu qemaung anga zua takets, aya.
mano qemaong anga zoa takec, aya.
S.TRANSL: So the muntjac cried, they say.

S.FORM: avan nu sika małetutsu anga temulats a takets "aa aa", aya a
avan no sika maljetoco anga temolac a takec "aa aa", aya a
S.TRANSL: tjautsikel.
